channel.title: Album Picks on pedro querido
channel.description: Recent content in Album Picks on pedro querido

item.title: Q's album pick of the month: April
item.description:
During the last month I’ve been in a math rock mood, probably thanks to my serious addicion to Crash of Rhinos. My pick for April is:

Animals by This Town Needs Guns (2008)

You can get it here: http://thistownneedsguns.bandcamp.com/album/animals

item.title: Q's album pick of the month: March
item.description:
Welcome to the first post of the Q’s album pick of the month series! Without further ado, the album that I pick for March is:

Distal by Crash of Rhinos (2011)

This album has been playing over and over again in my car. It’s my daily soundtrack during my commute to college. Great riffs, great drumming and tremendous energy from the first to the last track. It’s it an interesting blend of punk, post-rock, hardcore and math-rock.

You can get it for free (or maybe give these guys some support!) at bandcamp: http://crashofrhinos.bandcamp.com/album/distal

item.title: Introducing: Q's album pick of the month
item.description:
If you’re part of my friend circle, you surely know that I am a serious music addict. I’m the guy who’s frequently telling you to “give {band name here} a listen!“. I’m also the guy whose opinion some people trust when they are looking for something new to add to their music collection.

Given all this I decided that I’ll start posting a monthly album recommendation. This will usually be some great album that I’ve found and I feel like I should pass it forward. It will also serve as some sort of journal for my musical findings. In a few months it will be nice to be able to go back and find out what I was listening to.

I should note that these posts will be pretty simple. Just some album details, maybe an embedded track. But that’s it. I have no intentions to write reviews for these albums. And, after all, if I’m picking it it’s because I find it pretty good :)

Hope you enjoy it!
